intro: Sajorium africanum, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Sajorium africanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
